snippet: Defying weeks of international warnings of more censure and sanctions, North Korea launched a rocket on Friday, but it broke up just after liftoff, Japan said.
abstract: North Korea defies international warnings of more censure and sanctions and launches a rocket, but in what is a major embarrassment to the country and its new leader Kim Jong-un, it disintegrates moments after launching; American officials, who called the launching a provocative pretext for developing an intercontinental ballistic missile that might one day carry a nuclear warhead, say food aid will be suspended.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Choe Sang-hun reported from Seoul, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Martin Fackler from Tokyo, Mark Landler and Thom Shanker from Washington, David E. Sanger from Cambridge, Mass., and William J. Broad from New York.

lead_paragraph: Defying weeks of international warnings of more censure and sanctions, North Korea launched a rocket on Friday, but it broke up just after liftoff, Japan said.

headline.main: North Korean Rocket Fails Moments After Liftoff
headline.print_headline: North Korea, Defiant, Fails In Rocket Test
